'''Notion''' is a [[freemium]] productivity and [[note-taking]] [[web application]] developed by Notion Labs, Inc. It offers organizational tools including [[task management]], [[project management|project tracking]], [[time management|to-do lists]], and [[social bookmarking|bookmarking]]. Additional offline features are offered by desktop and mobile applications available for [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[macOS]], [[Android (operating system)|Android]], and [[iOS]]. Users can create custom templates, embed videos and web content, and [[Real-time collaborative editing|collaborate with others in real-time]].

==History==
Notion Labs, Inc. is a [[Startup company|startup]] based in [[San Francisco]], founded in 2013 by Ivan Zhao, Chris Prucha, Jessica Lam, Simon Last and Toby Schachman.<ref>{{Cite web |last= |first= |title=Notion Labs, Inc. Company Profile: Financials, Valuation, and Growth |url=https://system.privco.com/company/notion-labs |access-date=2022-07-21 |website=PrivCo |language=English}}</ref>

In March 2018, Notion 2.0 was released. At that point, the company had fewer than 10 employees.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://usefyi.com/notion-history/|title=How Ivan Zhao's Notion Is Going After Atlassian and Why It Just Might Win|last=Shah|first=Hiten|date=2019-05-28|website=FYI|access-date=2020-02-05}}</ref>

In June 2018, an [[Android (operating system)|Android]] app was released.<ref>{{cite web |url = https://www.theverge.com/2018/6/7/17434754/notion-android-app-notes-productivity-review |title = Notion brings its powerful note-taking app to Android |date = 7 June 2018 |work = [[The Verge]]}}</ref>

In September 2019, the company announced it had reached 1 million users.<ref name=":3" /> 

In January 2020, Notion had $50 million in investments from [[Index Ventures]] and others.<ref name=":3">{{Cite news|last=Griffith|first=Erin|date=2020-04-01|title=Notion, Maker of Collaboration Software, Raises $50 Million|language=en-US|work=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/01/technology/notion-startup-fund-raising.html|access-date=2021-09-08|issn=0362-4331}}</ref> In April 2020, it was valued at two billion dollars.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|date=2020-08-11|title=레고블록처럼 사용하는 생산성 앱 '노션' 한국어 버전 정식 출시|trans-title=Full release of productivity app 'Notion' in Korean|url=https://www.techm.kr/news/articleView.html?idxno=74234|access-date=2021-05-07|website=테크M|language=ko}}</ref>

On September 7, 2021, Notion acquired Automate.io, a [[Hyderabad]]-based startup.<ref>{{cite web |title=Notion acquires India's Automate.io in push to accelerate product expansion |url=https://techcrunch.com/2021/09/08/notion-acquires-indias-automate-io-in-push-to-accelerate-product-expansion/ |website=Techcrunch |date=8 September 2021 |access-date=1 October 2021}}</ref> In October of that year, a new round of funding led by [[Coatue Management]] and [[Sequoia Capital]] helped Notion raise $275 million. The investment valued Notion at $10 billion, and the company had 20 million users.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Konrad|first=Alex|title=Notion Reaches $10 Billion Valuation, Boosted By Remote Work — And TikTok|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/alexkonrad/2021/10/08/notion-raises-at-10-billion-valuation-boosted-by-remote-work-tiktok/|access-date=2022-01-28|website=Forbes|language=en}}</ref>

In 2022, Notion launched the Notion Certified Program, an accreditation for users to expand their use of the platform.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Lawrence |first=Lizzy |date=2022-03-02 |title=Notion wants to mobilize your Notion-obsessed employees |url=https://www.protocol.com/workplace/notion-conference-enterprise-productivity-influencer |access-date=2022-03-08 |website=Protocol |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Finnegan |first=Matthew |date=2022-03-04 |title=Coda and Notion turn up the heat on Microsoft Office |url=https://www.computerworld.com/article/3652691/coda-and-notion-turn-up-the-heat-on-microsoft-office.html |access-date=2022-03-08 |website=Computerworld |language=en}}</ref> It also joined the Security First Initiative, a group of tech companies pledged to share security information with their customers.<ref>{{Cite web |last= |first= |date=2022-03-08 |title=Utah-based Whistic leads out in new security-first initiative consortium |url=https://www.utahbusiness.com/utah-based-whistic-leads-out-in-new-security-first-initiative-consortium/ |access-date=2022-03-09 |website=Utah Business |language=en-US}}</ref>

In June 2022, Notion acquired the calendar software [[Cron (disambiguation)|Cron]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Notion Acquires Cron, the Next-Generation Calendar |url=https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20220609005319/en/Notion-Acquires-Cron-the-Next-Generation-Calendar |date=2022-06-09 |accessdate=2024-04-07 |website=[[Business Wire]] |last=Allison |first=Angela |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Notion acquires Cron, the next-generation calendar |url=https://www.notion.so/blog/notion-acquires-cron |date=2022-06-09 |accessdate=2024-04-07 |website=notion.so |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Cron × Notion |url=https://cron.com/blog/2022-06-09-cron+notion |date=2022-06-09 |accessdate=2024-04-07 |website=cron.com |last=Schaad |first=Raphael |language=en}}</ref>

In July 2022, Notion acquired FlowDash.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Carson |first=Biz |title=Why Notion bought Flowdash and did a tender offer - Protocol |url=https://www.protocol.com/workplace/notion-flowdash-acquisition-tender-offer |access-date=2024-02-12 |website=www.protocol.com |language=en}}</ref>

In November 2022, Notion announced its official Japanese release.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Notion「日本語正式版」になる |url=https://www.watch.impress.co.jp/docs/news/1454615.html |date=2022-11-10 |website=www.watch.impress.co.jp |accessdate=2022-11-10 }}</ref>

In February 2023, Notion released the "Notion AI" service that can be used on the workspace.<ref>{{Cite web |title=What Is Notion AI? The Latest Buzzy Writing Assistant, Explained |url=https://screenrant.com/what-is-notion-ai/ |date=2023-02-24 |website=screenrant.com |accessdate=2023-02-26 }}</ref>

In April 2023, Notion released [[multi-factor authentication]] for its users.<ref>{{Cite web |title=2-step verification – Notion Help Center |url=https://www.notion.so/help/two-step-verification |access-date=2023-05-02 |website=Notion |language=en-us}}</ref>

In November 2023, Notion released 'Q&A', a new AI feature which allows users to ask questions directly to AI and receive answers based on a wide range of information stored in the workspace.

On January 17, 2024, Notion released their second product 'Notion Calendar', a fully-featured calendar application with integrations to Notion pages and databases.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Notion launches a standalone calendar app |url=https://techcrunch.com/2024/01/17/notion-launches-a-calendar-app/ |date=2024-01-17 |accessdate=2024-04-07 |website=[[TechCrunch]] |last=Lardinois |first=Frederic |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Introducing Notion Calendar: an integrated calendar for work and life |url=https://www.notion.so/blog/introducing-notion-calendar |date=2024-01-17 |accessdate=2024-04-07 |website=notion.so |last=Schaad |first=Raphael |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Cron is now Notion Calendar |url=https://cron.com/blog/2024-01-17-cron-is-now-notion-calendar |date=2024-01-17 |accessdate=2024-04-07 |website=cron.com |last=Schaad |first=Raphael |language=en}}</ref>

On February 9, 2024, Notion acquired the email service [[Skiff (email service)|Skiff]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Kothari |first1=Akshay |title=Meet Skiff, the newest member of the Notion family |url=https://www.notion.so/blog/meet-skiff-the-newest-member-of-the-notion-family |website=Notion |access-date=10 February 2024 |language=en-us |date=9 February 2024}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Mehta |first1=Ivan |title=Notion acquires privacy-focused productivity platform Skiff |url=https://techcrunch.com/2024/02/09/notion-acquires-privacy-focused-productivity-platform-skiff/ |website=TechCrunch |access-date=10 February 2024 |date=10 February 2024}}</ref>

== Software ==
Notion is a [[Collaborative software|collaboration]] platform with [[Markdown]] and including [[kanban]] boards, tasks, [[Wiki software|wikis]] and databases. It is a workspace for [[Notetaking software|notetaking]], [[Knowledge management software|knowledge]] and [[Spreadsheet|data]] management, and [[Project management software|project and task management]].<ref>{{cite web|date=8 June 2018|title=Notion goes where Evernote dares not: what you need to know|url=https://androidcommunity.com/notion-goes-where-evernote-dares-not-what-you-need-to-know-20180608/|work=Android Community}}</ref> It has file management in a single workspace, allowing users to comment on ongoing projects, participate in discussions, and receive feedback.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Probst |first=Collin |date=2022-07-13 |title=5 things you need to know about Notion |url=https://www.techradar.com/features/5-things-you-need-to-know-about-notion |access-date=2022-12-20 |website=TechRadar |language=en}}</ref> It can be accessed by [[Cross-platform software|cross-platform]] apps and by most [[web browser]]s.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Raphael|first=J. R.|date=2021-10-27|title=3 fantastic ways Notion can make you more efficient|url=https://www.computerworld.com/article/3636153/3-fantastic-ways-notion-can-make-you-more-efficient.html|access-date=2022-02-08|website=Computerworld|language=en}}</ref>

It includes a "clipper" for screenshotting content from webpages.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Newton|first=Casey|date=2019-03-06|title=Notion's new web clipper makes it a powerful competitor to Evernote|url=https://www.theverge.com/2019/3/6/18251787/notion-evernote-web-clipper-import-tool|access-date=2022-02-02|website=The Verge|language=en}}</ref> It exists for users to schedule tasks, manage files, save documents, set reminders, keep agendas, and organize their work. [[LaTeX]] support allows writing and pasting equations in block or inline form.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Lee |first=Joel |date=2019-02-05 |title=The 7 Best Note-Taking Apps for Programmers and Coders |url=https://www.makeuseof.com/tag/best-note-taking-tools-programmers/ |access-date=2022-10-27 |website=MUO |language=en-US}}</ref>

Users can sign into Notion using their [[Google Account|Google account]], [[Apple ID]] or email.

== Features ==
Notion does not require specialized training to use. It uses AI and a library of free and fee-based templates, with the Notion AI functionality, users can write and improve content, summarize existing notes, daily standup, adjust the tone, translate or check text.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |last=Kelly |first=Will |date=2023-01-20 |title=Evernote and Notion take aim at enterprise collaboration market |url=https://www.techtarget.com/searchunifiedcommunications/tip/Evernote-and-Notion-take-aim-at-enterprise-collaboration-market |access-date=2023-02-14 |website=TechTarget |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Snyder |first=Brady |date=2023-02-24 |title=What Is Notion AI? The Latest Buzzy Writing Assistant, Explained |url=https://screenrant.com/what-is-notion-ai/ |access-date=2023-02-24 |website=ScreenRant |language=en}}</ref> Security features include [[Security Assertion Markup Language]] single sign-on and private team spaces for their Business and Enterprise tiers.<ref name=":1" />

Notion enables its users to integrate with more than 70 other SaaS tools, such as Slack, GitHub, GitLab, Zoom, Jira, Cisco Webex, Zapier, and Typeform.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Integrations |url=https://www.notion.so/integrations/gate/refresh |access-date=2023-10-27 |website=Notion |language=en-us}}</ref>

=== Blocks ===
Everything in Notion is made up of blocks. Including text, images, tables, and pages themselves. This allows users to easily customize a page by adding and moving blocks in various ways. In June 2021, Notion released a 'synced block', which is a type of block that, when copied and pasted across different pages in a user's workspace, shows edits between them.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Frank |first=Thomas |date=2021-05-10 |title=Notion Blocks: Everything You Need to Know |url=https://thomasjfrank.com/notion-blocks-guide/ |access-date=2023-05-02 |website=Thomas Frank |language=en-US}}</ref>

=== Databases ===
One of Notion's features is its database. Databases are used for storing information and can hold any number of rows and columns. By default, each row will have two pre-populated properties: 'Name' and 'Tags'. Users can add more properties, such as date, checkbox, multi-select, URL, and more. When creating databases, users can choose to either create it 'inline', within an already existing page, or as its own page.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Los |first=Sija |date=2022-12-09 |title=The Only Tutorial You'll Need to Get Your Notion Up and Running |url=https://medium.com/@Ramblingsofa20something/the-only-tutorial-youll-need-to-get-your-notion-up-and-running-1837657bbc5d |access-date=2023-05-02 |website=Medium |language=en}}</ref>

=== Templates ===
Notion users can make and use templates. Notion hosts its own template gallery, where users can browse through templates made by other Notion creators. However, not all of these templates are free to use. Some creators profit from selling Notion templates. Jason Ruiyi Chen, from Singapore, made $239,000 by selling his Notion templates to his Twitter audience. Thomas Frank, a YouTuber with 2.8 million subscribers as of February 2023, made $1 million in 2022.<ref>{{Cite web |title=The YouTuber Making $1 Million Selling Notion 'Templates' |url=https://www.theinformation.com/articles/the-youtuber-making-1-million-selling-notion-templates |access-date=2023-05-02 |website=The Information|date=14 February 2023 }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Courter |first=Emily |title=I made $239,000 this year selling budgeting and productivity templates online. It's the perfect business to start as a one-person team. |url=https://www.businessinsider.com/selling-notion-template-twitter-marketing-gum-road-digital-product |access-date=2023-05-02 |website=Business Insider |language=en-US}}</ref>

=== Notion AI ===
Notion AI uses [[artificial intelligence]], which enables prediction of some results, text generation and solving arithmetic. It will also work with other datasets in response to an input by the user of the AI. This AI can automate some tasks and assist the user to make a paragraph or outline from a single line of text. Notion AI has its own subscription set which is $10/month per person.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Notion AI |url=https://www.notion.so/product/ai |access-date=2023-05-28 |website=Notion |language=en-us}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Using Notion AI to extend your impact |url=https://www.notion.so/help/guides/using-notion-ai |access-date=2023-05-28 |website=Notion |language=en-us}}</ref> The service is powered by the API of [[Anthropic]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Notion is key partner of Anthropic. |url=https://twitter.com/AnthropicAI/status/1635679544521920512 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.today/20231228005636/https://twitter.com/AnthropicAI/status/1635679544521920512 |archive-date=2023-12-28}}</ref>

=== Notion Calendar ===
Notion Calendar integrates time management with the workspaces and databases within Notion. It allows you to see and manage your professional and personal events in one application, syncing with Google Calendar for consolidated scheduling. With Notion Calendar, you can link database entries to calendar events, enabling efficient planning and task tracking. To get started, users download the app, connect their calendar accounts, and can then integrate their Notion workspaces and databases for a unified view of tasks and schedules.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Schaad |first=Raphael |date=2024-01-17 |title=Introducing Notion Calendar — an integrated calendar for work and life |url=https://www.notion.so/blog/introducing-notion-calendar |access-date=2024-04-17 |website=Notion |language=en-us}}</ref>

=== Notion Partnerships ===
Notion also offers different types of partnerships,<ref>{{Cite web |title=Become a Notion partner |url=https://www.notion.so/become-a-partner |access-date=2024-04-17 |website=Notion |language=en-us}}</ref> with various focuses:

* '''Technology Partner Program:''' Your product + Notion platform = new tools for Notion users.
* '''Channel Partner Program:''' Support unique needs of Notion customers and grow your business.
* '''Startup Partner Program:''' Offer your startup network free Notion access and resources.
* '''Affiliate Partner Program:''' Refer Notion to friends and followers and earn unlimited rewards.

Some of Notion's current partners include: Zoom, Slack, Github, Google Drive, AWS, Asana, Figma, and Typeform.

== Pricing ==
Notion has a four tiered [[Subscription business model|subscription]] model: Free, Plus, Business, and Enterprise.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.notion.so/pricing|title=Notion Pricing Plans}}</ref> Users can also earn credit via [[Referral marketing|referrals]]. As of May 2020, the company changed the Personal plan to allow unlimited blocks.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Newton|first=Casey|date=2020-05-19|title=Notion just removed the biggest limit on its free plan|url=https://www.theverge.com/2020/5/19/21261811/note-taking-app-notion-free-plan-personal-use-unlimited-blocks|access-date=2021-11-07|website=The Verge|language=en}}</ref> Notion also offers a free student plan called "Notion for education".<ref>{{Cite web |title=Notion for education |url=https://www.notion.so/product/notion-for-education |access-date=2024-04-21 |website=Notion |language=en-us}}</ref>
